official-title.#text: Supporting the goals and ideals of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Awareness Month.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
supports the goals and ideals of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder
			 Awareness Month.

text.#text:
Whereas more than 5,200,000 people are estimated to live with posttraumatic stress disorder during
			 the course of a given year in the United States;

Whereas women are more likely than men to develop posttraumatic stress disorder during their
			 lifetime;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 experts believe roughly 11 to 20 percent of veterans who served in support
			 of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom suffer from
			 post-traumatic stress disorder;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Veterans Affairs National Center for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Center for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder

text.#text: Whereas less than 40 percent of returning military personnel seek assistance;

Whereas without treatment, posttraumatic stress disorder can lead to alcohol and drug abuse,
			 flashbacks, heart attacks, depression, suicide, and stroke;
Whereas posttraumatic stress disorder can cause pernicious effects in families and communities;

Whereas raising public awareness of this condition will help facilitate the discovery of effective
			 treatment options, therapies and a cure; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and people working across the United States to
			 improve the quality of life of people living with posttraumatic stress
			 disorder should be commended: Now, therefore, be it

text.#text: Whereas the dedication of organizations, researchers, doctors, medical facilities of the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 631 IH: Supporting the goals and ideals of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Awareness Month.
